text: Need medicationHey  first of all thanks to all of you working to help people with mental health issues  I wish I could do more myself  but I am caught up in my own problems I am bipolar  I have been diagnosed a few separate times  I have been on quite a few medications from anti depressants to anti psychotics  However  a few years ago  before I lost insurance  I decided to commit to getting help  I went through a long process and eventually got prescribed Lamotrigine  Lamictal  This medication was the first to really work for me  Things were going alright for a while  until I got a new doctor  just urgent care  who wouldn t extend my prescription without my previous medical records which due to a clerical error were in the wrong name  So I went off my meds cold turkey  Since then I have spiraled trying to get my life back  It s a few years later now  and I feel like I have tried everything but it hasn t worked  I quit my job and moved to a state with better health care  I ve told my family I need help  I keep getting denied healthcare  I make about   a year which is hardly enough to pay rent  but too much for care  I think about suicide every day  and I know that all I need to feel better enough to keep going is a pill that costs cents  I don t know how to find a doctor  I don t know how to get insurance  I ve been a bartender  which is now season because of moving  I am applying to any jobs with benefits  I m at a loss  My anxiety is through the roof  and I never look forward to waking up  I know I must be making this harder on myself than it needs to be  I know there has to be avenues to take  but I am so afraid of reaching out and being let down again that I am paralyzed  I am afraid that if I work really hard on getting better and nothing comes of it that I will give up   What can I do   And thanks for a low pressure environment
summary: Bipolar patient is depressed and needs medication. He lost his job and his health insurance. He is applying for any job with benefits. He thinks about suicide every day and is afraid of reaching out and being let down again.
cleaned: bipolar patient depressed need medication lose job health insurance apply job benefit think suicide day afraid reach let

text: People keep confusing racism as a whole with systematic racism I m going to bed so I know this sit he worst type of post to make as of now but yeah  I can t respond until the morning  although it s be cool for everybody else to debate rather than ask me questions Ok so the majority of people I know  and majority on social media  believe that it is absolutely impossible for any black person to be racist towards any whites person  usually because of power Just going of the basis that the white person automatically has power over the black person is self deprecating and simply not true And also it doesn t take into account the fact that it s only one form of racism Yes systematic racism can exist  the extent of which it exists can be debatable  but anyway yes  someone can use their power to punish someone based on their skin colour But even then  that doesn t mean only white people can be racist in that sense  I mean because Obama was the most powerful person in America  white people now can t be racist Anyway yeah  it s literally in the name  racism is racially motivated  the word isn t called whitepeopleracisttowardsblackpeopleism but it s someone of   race discriminating someone else because of their race Hard times one group went through doesn t mean they can t  on an individual level  do that thing back and it s absurd to think they can t If a black person came up to me and said  black people are superior to white peoples  white people are vile scum  I hate the colour of their skin  I think that s racist and yet even then  many think that isn t Also every single dictionary will give the multiple forms of racism  as there is just one form like I said Ok so like I said  I m going to bed  I d love comments on here maybe explaining why I may be wrong but it s best if questions aren t asked as I m going to bed now lol
